sen.j: 上村 松園（うえむら しょうえん、本名：上村 津禰（つね）（常子（つねこ）とも）、1875年（明治8年）4月23日 - 1949年（昭和24年）8月27日）は、明治の京都府下京（しもぎょう）に生まれ育ち、女性の目を通して「美人画」を描いた日本画。
sen.e: Shoen UEMURA (real name: Tsune or Tsuneko UEMURA from April 23, 1875, to August 27, 1949), born and raised at Shimogyo, Kyoto Prefecture, was a Japanese-style painter who drew "Bijinga ('Beautiful Woman Painting')" from a woman's viewpoint.

Shoen UEMURA (real name: Tsune or Tsuneko UEMURA, April 23, 1875, - August 27, 1949), born and raised at Shimogyo, Kyoto Prefecture, was a Japanese-style painter who drew "Bijinga ('Beautiful Woman Painting')" from a woman's viewpoint.

Shoen UEMURA (real name: Tsune or Tsuneko UEMURA, April 23, 1875, - August 27, 1949), born and raised at Shimogyo, Kyoto Prefecture in the Meiji period, was a Japanese-style painter who drew 'Bijinga' ('Beautiful Woman Painting') from a woman's viewpoint.
sen.cmt: 「明治の」→in the Meiji periodとして訳出、原文に合わせシングルクォーテーションに変更、および位置を移動

sen.j: 同じく日本画家の上村松篁（しょうこう）は息子、上村淳之（あつし）は孫にあたる。
sen.e: Shoko UEMURA, a Japanese-style painter, is her son, while Atsushi UEMURA is her grandson.
Her son, Shoko UEMURA, and grandson, Atsushi UEMURA, are Japanese-style painters.
Her son, Shoko UEMURA, and grandson, Atsushi UEMURA, are Japanese-style painters.

tit.e: Traditional Manners of Kyoto, Ancient Capital of Japan

sen.j: 京都市下京区四条通御幸町の葉茶屋「ちきり屋」の次女として生まれ、京の伝統文化に育まれた松園は、明治・大正・昭和を通して生涯、「一点の卑俗なところもなく、清澄な感じのする香高い珠玉のような絵」、「真・善・美の極致に達した本格的な美人画」（松園のことば）を念願として女性を描き続けた。
sen.e: She spent all her life through the eras of Meiji, Taisho and Showa drawing women true to her commitment to draw, as she said, "paintings that are exquisite like jewels perfumed with cleanliness, purity, and classiness" and "authentic 'bijinga' paintings that show the ultimate status of truth, goodness and beauty.

The second daughter of the owners of a tea shop in central Kyoto, Shoen grew up surrounded by traditional Kyoto culture and spent her whole life painting women, aiming to produce, in her own words, "pictures like exquisite jewels, clear and without a trace of vulgarity" and "authentic 'bijinga' paintings that are the culmination of truth, goodness and beauty."
sen.cmt: Reworded sentence - left out "明治・大正・昭和を通して" as irrelevant for most English speakers
sen.e: The second daughter of the owners of a tea shop in central Kyoto, Shoen grew up surrounded by traditional Kyoto culture and spent her whole life painting women, aiming to produce, in her own words, 'pictures like exquisite jewels, clear and without a trace of vulgarity' and 'authentic 'bijinga' paintings that are the culmination of truth, goodness and beauty.'
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更

sen.j: 松園は誕生2ヶ月前に父を亡くしている。
sen.e: Shoen lost her father two months before her birth.
Shoen's father died two months before she was born.
Shoen's father died two months before she was born.

sen.j: 母仲子は女手一つで松園と姉、二人の娘を育て上げた。
sen.e: Her mother Nakako raised her two daughters, Shoen and her elder sister, by herself.
Her mother Nakako raised Shoen and her elder sister by herself.
Her mother Nakako raised Shoen and her elder sister by herself.

sen.j: 明治の女性が画家を志すなど、世間で認めるところではなかったが、仲子は常に松園を理解し励まし支え続けた。
sen.e: Although the idea of women trying to become painters was never approved in the society in the Meiji period, Nakako constantly continued to understand and encourage her daughter.
Although Meiji society did not approve of women wanting to become artists, Nakako continuously supported Shoen, offering undeerstanding and encouragement.
sen.cmt: Reworded sentence - left "Meiji" but I wonder if something like "late 19th century Japanese" might be better for non-Japanese
sen.e: Although Meiji society did not approve of women wanting to become artists, Nakako continuously supported Shoen, offering undeerstanding and encouragement.

sen.j: 松園はその著書『青眉抄』で母を追憶して下記のようにと述べている。
sen.e: Shoen wrote in her essay "Seibisho" in memory of her mother that
Reminiscing about her mother in her essay "Seibisho", Shoen wrote,
Reminiscing about her mother in her essay "Seibisho," Shoen wrote as follows.

sen.j: 「私は母のおかげで、生活の苦労を感じずに絵を生命とも杖ともして、それと闘えたのであった。」
sen.e: "It was because of my mother that I successfully and adamantly fought a fight for my career with the painting as my life and cane without feeling the pain of daily living."
sen.cmt: 「それと闘う」は「自分の仕事のために闘う」と解釈しました。
sen.e: "It was because of my mother that I was able to paint, making pictures my life and my crutch, without experiencing life's hardships.
It was because of my mother that I was able to paint, making pictures my life and my crutch, without experiencing life's hardships.'
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更

sen.j: 「私を生んだ母は、私の芸術までも生んでくれたのである。」
sen.e: "My mother gave birth to me as well as my art."
As well as giving birth to me, my mother gave birth to my art."
As well as giving birth to me, my mother gave birth to my art.'
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更

sen.j: 母を亡くした後には、「母子」「青眉」「夕暮」「晩秋」など母を追慕する格調高い作品が生まれた。
sen.e: The loss of her mother lead to her creation of a few dignified works including "Mother and Child," "Ao-mayu," "Evenfall," and "Late Autumn."
The loss of her mother led her to produce several dignified pieces including "Mother and Child", "Ao-mayu (Blue Eyebrows)", "Evenfall", and "Late Autumn".
sen.cmt: "lead to her creation of a few"→"led her to produce several""works"→"pieces"- Not sure why only "Ao-Mayu" is left untranslated so added "(Blue Eyebrows)"Moved commas outside inverted coomas
sen.e: The loss of her mother led her to produce several dignified pieces including 'Mother and Child,' 'Ao-mayu' (Blue Eyebrows), 'Evenfall,' and 'Late Autumn.'
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更、カンマ・ピリオド・クォーテーション内のカッコ文の位置を移動

sen.j: 気品あふれる作品群の中で、特異な絵が2枚ある。
sen.e: Two of her graceful works are very unique.
Among her many graceful works, two stand out as unique
Among her many graceful works, two stand out as unique.

sen.j: 「花がたみ」と「焔（ほのお）」である。
sen.e: They are "Hana-gatami" (Flower Basket) and "Hono-o" (Flame).
They are "Hana-gatami" (Flower Basket) and "Hono-o" (Flame).
They are 'Hana-gatami' (Flower Basket) and 'Hono-o' (Flame).
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更

sen.j: 1915年の「花がたみ」の題材、謡曲「花筐（はながたみ）」は、継体天皇の皇子時代に寵を受けた「照日の前」が形見の花筐を手に都に上り、紅葉狩りに行き逢った帝の前で舞うという内容である。
sen.e: "Hana-gatami" drawn in 1915 was based on a yokyoku (one of Japanese traditional music genres) "Hana-gatami," which tells a story of Teruhi-no-mae, a woman loved by Emperor Keitai when he was a prince, who followed him as he went to Kyoto to become the Emperor and performed a dance in front of the Emperor during his visit to the mountains for viewing of autumnal leaves; although she was frantic when she met the Emperor, he recognized her as his former lover because of the flower basket she always had with her, which was the gift he gave to her when he was a prince.
sen.cmt: この日本語の記述だけではよく意味がわかりません（例えば「形見」とは普通は死んだ人について言う言葉だと思います）ので、調べてその内容をもとに英文を作成しました。
sen.e: "Hana-gatami", painted in 1915, was based on the yokyoku (song used in Noh) of the same name, which tells the story of Teruhi-no-mae, a woman loved by Emperor Keitai when he was a prince, who went to Kyoto, met the Emperor by chance at an autumn leaf viewing party and performed a dance holding a flower basket she had received from him as a gift.
sen.cmt: Added commas"drawn"→"painted""a"→"the""one of Japanese traditional music genres"→"song used in Noh"""Hana-gatami,"→"of the same name,""a"→"the"Agree with the translator that such a detailed explanation isn't really necessary so deleted most of the phrases not in the Japanese original
sen.e: Hana-gatami,' painted in 1915, was based on the yokyoku (song used in Noh) of the same name, which tells the story of 'Teruhi no mae,' a woman loved by Emperor Keitai when he was a prince, who went to Kyoto, met the Emperor by chance at an autumn leaf viewing party and performed a dance holding a flower basket she had received from him as a gift.
sen.cmt: 原文に合わせシングルクォーテーションに変更、カンマの位置を移動、ハイフンをとりクォーテーションをつけ'Teruhi no mae'としました。

sen.j: 208×127cmの大作である。
sen.e: The work is a big-size one measuring 208 cm x 127 cm.
The work is large, measuring 208 cm x 127 cm.
The work is large, measuring 208 cm x 127 cm.

sen.j: 松園は能面「十寸髪（ますがみ）」を狂女の顔の参考にしたという。
sen.e: It was said that Shoen drew the face of a frantic woman based on the noh mask "Masugami."
It was said that Shoen based the face of the mad woman on the noh mask known as "Masugami."
It was said that Shoen based the face of the mad woman on the noh mask known as 'Masugami.'
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更

sen.j: 1918年の「焔」の題材、謡曲「葵上」は、『源氏物語』に登場する六条御息所の生霊を桃山風俗にて描いた、松園言うところの「数多くある絵のうち、たった一枚の凄艶な絵」である。
sen.e: The work "Hono-o" created in 1918 is based on the theme of another yokyoku "Aoi-no-ue," which deals with fictional figures in the Tale of Genji, and she said it was "the only work of a woman looking thrillingly seductive among many of my works."
sen.cmt: 段落わけする分節を変えました。
sen.e: "Hono-o", created in 1918 and based on another yokyoku "Aoi-no-ue," is painted in the Momyama style and depicts Rokujo no Miyasudokoro from the Tale of Genji; Shoen said it was "the only work one of my many pictures to depict such a seductive woman."
sen.cmt: Deleted "The work"Added commasDeleted "the theme of""which deals with fictional figures in"→"is painted in the Momyama style and depicts Rokujo no Miyasudokoro from" - as in Japanese original"she"→"Shoen""work of a woman looking thrillingly seductive among many of my works"→"one of my many pictures to depict such a seductive woman"
sen.e: Hono-o,' created in 1918 and based on another yokyoku 'Aoi no ue,' is painted in the Momyama style and depicts Rokujo no Miyasudokoro from the "Tale of Genji"; Shoen said it was 'the only work one of my many pictures to depict such a seductive woman.'
sen.cmt: 原文に合わせシングルクォーテーションに変更、カンマの位置を移動、「葵上」→ハイフンをとり 'Aoi no ue'とし、『源氏物語』→クォーテーションをつけ"Tale of Genji"としました。

sen.j: （誇り高い六条御息所は光源氏の正妻、葵の上への屈辱と嫉妬から生霊になり、葵の上を取り殺してしまう）。
sen.e: The woman drawn in the Momoyama manner in this picture is Rokujo no Miyasudokoro, who was a highly proud noble woman and former lover of Hikaru Genji, became a vengeful spirit as a live human out of humiliation and jealousy toward his legal wife Aoi-no-ue and haunted her to death, and the garment Rokujo no Miyasudokoro wears as she bits loose hair has wisteria flowers and spider nests as design patterns.

Rokujo no Miyasudokoro was a proud noble woman and former lover of Hikaru Genji, who became a vengeful spirit because of her humiliation of and jealousy toward his wife Aoi-no-ue and haunted her to death. The picture shows her biting a stand of hair and wearing a kimono ith a pattern of spider webs and wisteria flowers.
sen.cmt: Reworded sentence - moved part to sentence above. Also, as the Japanese has two sentences, added full stop
sen.e: Rokujo no Miyasudokoro was a proud noble woman and former lover of Hikaru Genji, who became a vengeful spirit because of her humiliation of and jealousy toward his wife Aoi no ue and haunted her to death.
sen.cmt: 「葵上」→ハイフンをとりAoi no ueとしました。

sen.j: 後れ毛を噛む女の着物には藤の花と蜘蛛の巣が描かれている。
sen.e: The picture shows her biting a stand of hair and wearing a kimono ith a pattern of spider webs and wisteria flowers.
sen.cmt: 35行目の原文セル内に二文入っていたため、二文目をこちらに移動しました。(原文・訳文とも)

sen.j: 189×90cmの大作で、大変な迫力をもって見る者に迫る絵である。
sen.e: It is a big-sized work, measuring 189 cm x 90 cm, and is a very powerful painting that never fails to impress the viewers.
It is a large work, measuring 189 cm x 90 cm, and is a very powerful painting that never fails to impress viewers.
It is a large work, measuring 189 cm x 90 cm, and is a very powerful painting that never fails to impress viewers.

tit.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正

sen.j: 1875年、京都の下京区四条通御幸町の葉茶屋「ちきり屋」の次女として生まれる。
sen.e: Shoen was born as a second daughter of the owner of Chikiri-ya, a leaf tea store, located at Shijo-dori Gokomachi, Shimogyo Ward, Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: 「・・の次女として生まれる」はは「人」が来ると思いますので、「ちきり屋」のオーナーの次女として生まれた、としました。
sen.e: Shoen was born as the second daughter of the owner of Chikiri-ya, a leaf tea store, located at Shijo-dori Gokomachi, Shimogyo Ward, Kyoto City.
1875: Shoen was born as the second daughter of the owner of Chikiri-ya, a leaf tea store, located at Gokomachi, Shijo Street, Shimogyo Ward, Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: 「1875年」を訳出、住所表記を統一事項に基づき修正

sen.j: 1887年、京都画学校に入学、四条派の鈴木松年（すずきしょうねん）に師事。
sen.e: In 1887, she entered Kyoto Gagakko (Kyoto School of Drawing) and studied under Shonen SUZUKI who belonged to the Shijo-ha School.
In 1887, she entered Kyoto Gagakko (Kyoto School of Drawing) and studied under Shonen SUZUKI, who was a member of the Shijo-ha School.
sen.cmt: Added comma"belonged to"→"was a member of"
sen.e: 1887: She entered Kyoto Gagakko (Kyoto School of Drawing) and studied under Shonen SUZUKI, who was a member of the Shijo-ha School.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正

sen.j: 1890年、第3回内国勧業博覧会に「四季美人図」を出品、一等褒状受賞（この絵を、来日中であったヴィクトリア (イギリス女王)の三男アーサー (コノート公)が購入し話題となった）。
sen.e: In 1890, she submitted her work "Shiki Bijin-zu" (lit. "Paintings of Beautiful Women in Four Seasons") to the 3rd National Industrial Exhibition and won the First Meritorious Award (Her work was purchased by the Prince Arthur, Duke of Connaught, the third son of Victoria, Queen of England, who happened to be visiting Japan, and that drew a lot of attention).

In 1890, she submitted her work "Shiki Bijin-zu" (lit. "Paintings of Beautiful Women in Four Seasons") to the 3rd National Exposition and won the First Meritorious Award (She drew attention when her work was purchased by Prince Arthur, Duke of Connaught, the third son of Victoria, Queen of England, who was visiting Japan).
sen.cmt: "Industrial Exhibition"→"Exposition" "and that drew a lot of attention"→"She drew attention when" and moved"happened to be"→"was"
sen.e: 1890: She submitted her work 'Shiki Bijin-zu' (lit. 'Paintings of Beautiful Women in Four Seasons') to the Third National Exposition and won the First Meritorious Award (She drew attention when her work was purchased by Prince Arthur, Duke of Connaught, the third son of Victoria, Queen of England, who was visiting Japan).
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正、原文に合わせシングルクォーテーションに変更、3rd→Thirdとしました。

sen.j: 1893年、幸野楳嶺（こうのばいれい）に師事。
sen.e: In 1893, she studied under Bairei KONO.
In 1893, she studied under Bairei KONO.
1893: She studied under Bairei KONO.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正

sen.j: 火事のため高倉蛸薬師に転居。
sen.e: Her house was burned down, so she moved to Takakura-Takoyakushi.
Her house burned down, so she moved to Takakura-Takoyakushi.
Her house burned down, so she moved to Takakura-Takoyakushi.

sen.j: 市村水香に漢学を学び始める。
sen.e: She started learning sinology from Suiko ICHIMURA.
She started studying Chinese classics under Suiko ICHIMURA.
She started studying Chinese classics under Suiko ICHIMURA.

sen.j: 1895年、楳嶺の死去にともない、竹内栖鳳に師事。
sen.e: In 1895, she started studying under Seiho TAKEUCHI after the death of Bairei.
In 1895, she started studying under Seiho TAKEUCHI after the death of Bairei.
1895: She started studying under Seiho TAKEUCHI after the death of Bairei.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正

sen.j: 1902年、息子信太郎（松篁）が誕生。
sen.e: In 1902, she gave birth to her first son Shintaro (Shoko).
In 1902, she gave birth to her first son, Shintaro (Shoko).
1902: She gave birth to her first son, Shintaro (Shoko).
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正

sen.j: 1903年、車屋町御池に転居。
sen.e: In 1903, she moved to Kuramayacho-Oike.
In 1903, she moved to Kuramayacho-Oike.
1903: She moved to Kurumayacho-Oike.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正、Kuramayacho-Oike→Kurumayacho-Oikeに修正

sen.j: 1914年、間元町竹屋町に画室竣工。
sen.e: In 1914, she set up an atelier in Ainomachi-Takeyamachi.
In 1914, she set up an atelier in Ainomachi-Takeyamachi.
1914: She set up an atelier in Ainomachi-Takeyamachi.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正

sen.j: 金剛巌に謡曲を習い始める。
sen.e: She started learning yokyoku from Iwao KONGO.
She started learning yokyoku from Iwao KONGO.
She started learning yokyoku from Iwao KONGO.

sen.j: 1934年、母、仲子没。
sen.e: In 1934, her mother Nakako died.
In 1934, her mother Nakako died.
1934: Her mother Nakako died.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正

sen.j: 1941年、帝国芸術院会員。
sen.e: In 1941, she became a member of the Imperial Art Academy.
In 1941, she became a member of the Imperial Art Academy.
1941: She became a member of the Imperial Art Academy.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正

sen.j: 1945年、奈良平城の唳禽荘に疎開。
sen.e: In 1945, she moved to Reikin-so, a resort villa, in Nara-Heijo to avoid bombing.
In 1945, she moved to Reikin-so, a resort villa in Nara-Heijo, to avoid bombing.
1945: She moved to Reikin-so, a resort villa in Nara-Heijo, to avoid bombing.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正

sen.j: 1948年、文化勲章受章（日本人女性として初）。
sen.e: In 1948, she was awarded the Order of Culture, the first Japanese women who received it.
In 1948, she became the first Japanese woman to be awarded the Order of Culture
1948: She became the first Japanese woman to be awarded the Order of Culture
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正

sen.e: In 1949, she died.
She died in 1949.
1949: She died.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正

sen.j: 従四位に叙される。
sen.e: She was granted Jushimi (Junior Fourth Court Rank).
She was granted Jushimi (Junior Fourth Court Rank).
She was granted Jushii (Junior Fourth Rank).
sen.cmt: 従四位→統一リストの読み・表記に修正

sen.j: 享年74。
sen.e: She was 74 years old.

sen.j: 法名 (浄土真宗)は、寿慶院釋尼松園。
sen.e: Her posthumous Buddhist name in Jodo Shin-shu Sect is Jukeiin Shakuni Shoen.
Her posthumous Buddhist name from the Jodo Shin-shu Sect is Jukeiin Shakuni Shoen.
Her posthumous Buddhist name from Jodo Shinshu (the True Pure Land Sect of Buddhism) is Jukeiin Shakuni Shoen.
sen.cmt: 浄土真宗→Jodo Shinshu (the True Pure Land Sect of Buddhism)としました。

sen.j: 清少納言（せいしょうなごん：御簾を掲げる）1892
sen.e: Seishonagon (lifting up a bamboo blind), 1892
Sei Shonagon (lifting up a bamboo blind), 1892
Sei Shonagon (lifting up a bamboo blind), 1892

sen.j: 娘深雪（むすめみゆき：浄瑠璃「朝顔日記」より）1914
sen.e: Musume Miyuki (from a joruri (ballad drama) work, Asagao Nikki, 1914
Musume Miyuki (based on the joruri (ballad drama), "Asagao Nikki"), 1914
sen.cmt: "from a"→"based on the"Deleted "work"Added inverted commas and closing bracket
sen.e: Musume Miyuki (based on the joruri (ballad drama), 'Asagao Nikki'), 1914
sen.cmt: 原文にあわせシングルクォーテーションに変更

sen.j: 花がたみ（はながたみ：謡曲「花筐」より）1915
sen.e: Hana-gatami (based on a yokyokyu Hana-gatami), 1915
Hana-gatami (based on the yokyokyu, "Hana-gatami"), 1915
Hana-gatami (based on the yokyoku, 'Hana-gatami'), 1915
sen.cmt: yokyokyu→yokyokuに修正、シングルクォーテーションに変更

sen.j: 焔（ほのお：謡曲「葵上」より）1918
sen.e: Hono-o (based on a yokyoku Aoi-no-ue), 1918
Hono-o (based on the yokyoku, "Aoi-no-ue"), 1918
Hono-o (based on the yokyoku, 'Aoi no ue'), 1918

sen.j: 楊貴妃（ようきひ）1922
sen.e: Yokihi (Princess Yang Kwei-fei), 1922
Yokihi (Princess Yang Kwei-fei), 1922
Yokihi (Princess Yang Kwei-fei), 1922

sen.j: 伊勢大輔（いせのたゆう：平安前期の歌人）1930
sen.e: ISE no Taifu (a poet in the early part of the Heian Period), 1930
ISE no Taifu (an early Heian period poet), 1930
sen.cmt: "in the early part of the Heian Period"→"early Heian period" and moved
sen.e: ISE no Taifu (an early Heian period poet), 1930

sen.j: 草子洗い小町（そうしあらいこまち：謡曲および金剛巌の能舞台より）1937
sen.e: Soshi-arai Komachi (based on a yokyoku and Iwao KONGO's noh performance
Soshi-arai Komachi (based on a yokyoku and Iwao KONGO's noh performance), 1937
Soshi-arai Komachi (based on a yokyoku and Iwao KONGO's noh performance), 1937

sen.j: 古歌の剽窃との濡れ衣を掛けられた小町はその証拠とされる草子を洗って疑いを晴らしたという題材
sen.e: The base story is that Komachi was charged for a false accusation that her poem was a plagiarism of an old poem included in a bound poem book and cleared the suspicion by washing the book to erase the false old poem.
The basic story is that Komachi was accused of plagiarizing an old poem included in a bound poem book and cleared the suspicion by washing the book to erase the old poem.
sen.cmt: "base"→"basic""charged for a false accusation that her poem was a plagiarism"→"accused of plagiarizing"deleted "false"
sen.e: The basic story is that Komachi was accused of plagiarizing an old poem included in a bound poem book and cleared the suspicion by washing the book to erase the old poem.

sen.j: 雪月花 （三幅対：皇太后御用画）1937
sen.e: Setsugekka ("Snow, the Moon and Flowers") (Sampuku-tsui (triplicity), drawn at the request of the Empress Dowager), 1937
Setsugekka ("Snow, Moon and Flowers") (Sampuku-tsui (set of three), drawn at the request of the Empress Dowager), 1937
Setsugekka (Snow, Moon and Flowers) (Sanpuku-tsui (set of three), drawn at the request of the Empress Dowager), 1937
sen.cmt: 原文にないためクォーテーションをとりました。Sampuku-tsui→Sanpuku-tsuiとしました。

sen.j: 砧（きぬた：謡曲「砧 (能)」の妻の端麗な姿を元禄風俗にて）1938
sen.e: Kinuta (depicting the graceful "wife" in yokyoku "Kinuta" (a noh drama) in the Genroku manner), 1938
Kinuta (depicting the graceful wife from the yokyoku "Kinuta" (a noh drama), painted in the Genroku manner), 1938
Kinuta (depicting the graceful wife from the yokyoku 'Kinuta' (a noh drama), painted in the Genroku manner), 1938

Shizuka (Shizuka-gozen), 1944
Shizuka (Shizuka-gozen), 1944

sen.j: 人生の花（婚礼の席に向かう花嫁とその母の姿）1899
sen.e: Jinsei-no-hana ("Bloom of Life") (depicting the bridge and her mother walking to the ceremony)
Jinsei-no-hana ("Bloom of Life") (depicting the bride and her mother walking to the ceremony)
Jinsei no hana (Bloom of Life) (depicting the bride and her mother walking to the ceremony), 1899
sen.cmt: ハイフン、クォーテーションをとり、Jinsei no hana (Bloom of Life)としました。「1899」を訳出

sen.j: 舞支度（一対）1914
sen.e: Mai-jitaku ("Preparation for Dance") (Ittsui), 1914
Mai-jitaku ("Preparation for Dance") (a set of two), 1914

sen.e: Mai-jitaku (Preparation for Dance) (a set of two), 1914

sen.j: 待月、良宵之図 1926
sen.e: Machi−ｚuki ("Waiting for the Moon") (depicting a woman waiting for the moon) and Ryosho-no-zu ("Painting of Comfortable Moonlit Night), 1926
Machi−ｚuki ("Waiting for the Moon") and Ryosho-no-zu ("Painting of Comfortable Moonlit Night), 1926
sen.cmt: Deleted "(depicting a woman waiting for the moon)" - not in original Japanes and doesn't add anything to the painting's title
sen.e: Machi−ｚuki (Waiting for the Moon) and Ryosho no zu (Painting of Comfortable Moonlit Night), 1926
sen.cmt: クォーテーション削除、およびRyosho no zuとしました。

sen.j: 簾のかげ、新蛍 1929

sen.j: 春秋図（一対：うら若い娘たちを春に、やや年長の女を秋に見立てた図）1930
sen.e: Shunju-zu ("Painting of Spring and Autumn") (Ittsui: a painting of an elderly woman seen as autumn), 1930
Shunju-zu ("Painting of Spring and Autumn") (a set of two: a painting of young girls representing spring and an elderly woman representing autumn), 1930
sen.cmt: "Ittsui"→"a set of two"Added "young girls representing spring and""seen as"→"representing"
sen.e: Shunju-zu (Painting of Spring and Autumn) (a set of two: a painting of young girls representing spring and an elderly woman representing autumn), 1930
sen.cmt: クォーテーション削除

sen.j: 序の舞（「なにものにも犯されない、女性のうちにひそむ強い意志」を静かなうちに凛として気品のある仕舞「序の舞」を通して描いている）1936（重要文化財）
sen.e: Jo-no-mai (a painting of a woman expressing an "inviolable strong will hidden in the women," who serenely, bravely and gracefully performs a shimai or noh dance in plain clothes "Jo-no-mai"), 1936 (Important Cultural Heritage)

Jo-no-mai (a painting of a woman expressing the "inviolable strong will hidden in women," who serenely, bravely and gracefully performs a shimai or noh dance in plain clothes "Jo-no-mai"), 1936 (Important Cultural Heritage)

Jo no mai (a painting of a woman expressing the 'inviolable strong will hidden in women,' who serenely, bravely and gracefully performs a shimai or noh dance in plain clothes 'Jo no mai'), 1936 (Important Cultural Heritage)
sen.cmt: Jo-no-maiのハイフンをとり、全角スペースを半角に修正、原文に合わせシングルクォーテーションに変更

sen.j: 後に宮尾登美子によって書かれた松園の伝記の題名にもなった。
sen.e: The title was later used by a novelist Tomiko MIYAO for the title of her book on the biography of Shoen.
The title was later used by novelist Tomiko MIYAO for the title of her biography of Shoen.
The title was later used by novelist Tomiko MIYAO for the title of her biography of Shoen.

sen.j: 宮尾の作品『序の舞』はさらに映像化もされており、明治期の周囲の無理解に屈することなく画業を貫いた松園とそれを支えた母勢以の生き方が活写されている（1984年、東映、主演名取裕子）
sen.e: Miyao's work Jo-no-mai was also filmed, and the movie vividly depicts the life of Shoen, who explored her way as a professional woman painter in the face of the lack of understanding of the people in the Meiji Period, and her mother Sei (1984, Toei, starred by Yuko NATORI).

Miyao's Jo-no-mai was also filmed, and the movie vividly depicts the lives of Shoen as she tries to make her way in the unsympathetic art world of the Meiji era and her supportive mother, Sei (1984, Toei, starring Yuko NATORI).
sen.cmt: Deleted "work"Made "life" plural"starred by"→"starring"", who explored her way as a professional woman painter in the face of the lack of understanding of the people in the Meiji"→"as she tries to make her way in the unsympathetic art world of the Meiji era"Added "supportive" and comma
sen.e: Miyao's "Jo no mai" was also filmed, and the movie vividly depicts the lives of Shoen as she tries to make her way in the unsympathetic art world of the Meiji period and her supportive mother, Sei (1984, Toei, starring Yuko NATORI).
sen.cmt: Jo-no-maiのハイフンをとりクォーテーション追加、the Meiji era→the Meiji periodとしました。
